result.execSummary:
The defendant Georgia L Triplett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory  court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments. To be paid  while on probation or to serve five (5) days in HOC, consecutive.  Bail to apply. to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant may request an extension if not paid in full.
Maintain fulltime employment, school or a combination of both, unless it is determined she cannot work.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that her  voting rights are suspended and may  not vote in any election until her  civil rights are restored.
Complete a mental health evaluation.  Must comply with any recommended treatment.

No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with Walgreens pharmacy at 3522 W. Wisconsin Ave.
No association with known drug users or dealers. No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Advise any doctor that she is on probation for this case.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular  monthly payments.

AODA assessment. Must comply with any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first six months, and then be tested once per month randomly.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive.  STAYED to be used by the agent for any violations: to serve 10 days for the first violation; 20 days for the second; and 60 days for the third.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Georgia L Triplett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad

Defendant Georgia L Triplett in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.  

Sentencing continued.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Court gives credit for 37 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 90 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 60 days for the third violation.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment.
- Advise any doctor that she is on probation for this case.
- AODA assessment and must comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first six months, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both, unless it is determined she can not work..
- No contact with Walgreens pharmacy at 3522 West Wisconsin Ave.  
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 5 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant may request an extension if not paid in full.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Defendant Georgia L Triplett in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statement by state.  Case adjourned off the record for continued sentencing, due to an emergecy with the court reporter, on 10/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Georgia L Triplett in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 10/3/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
